website_summaries.verdict: A combination of performance and stability is what the Altra Impluse can offer. It is ideal for road running, light trail and cross training. It is a very lightweight shoe that provides exceptional flexibility. Based on the user reviews, the Impulse still needs a few improvements, especially on its cushioning and durability aspects.
pros: The Altra Impulse features the built-in drainage holes to shed water and to enhance breathability
Some runners took note of the light weight and flexibility feature of this shoe
StabiliPod technology prevents excessive foot pronation, remarked a few testers
Many runners were happy with how comfortable the Impulse is
This shoe has an impressive stability feature as cited in some reviews
cons: Some observed that exterior part of the shoe starts ripping off earlier than expected
Based on some reviews, the toe box is too narrow

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe! It has really held up for 100+ miles. I like to plant forefoot or maybe slightly midfoot so these worked well for me. I also like lightweight, somewhat less supportive soles, which these are great for. Don't get me wrong though, these soles do have a lot of bounce, just not as much as really thick ones. I'd probably buy these gain. This is my first time buying Altra and I really liked it!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: I really like them but I have bunions so I thought the ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like them but I have bunions so I thought the wide toe box would be good. My left foot, which is a bit bigger, is snug. I'm hoping they break in a little bit so the left feels as comfortable as the right. I might have been able to go up a half size but I was afraid it would then feel too big on my right foot. I do love the look of them and I get a lot of compliments :)
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: Well I've bought several Altra shoes and I've always bought size 9 and they only had these in 9.5 used in the Outlet store so I bought them at a greatly reduced price. They are a tiny bit large. Not enough to send them back. I'm not running road races in them or anything. So I would say they run pretty much true to size. A size 9 would have been perfect in Altra size.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Finally a SANE shoe-shape!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 8.5. I previously purchased a 9 as the 8.5 was a bit short. I handwashed the 9 and, when it had dried, it was too short. So, my second purchase was the 9.5 which fits fine. That prompted me to buy a third pair. I really love even the idea of this shoe. I LOVE the wide toebox and, most importantly, that the toes DO NOT come to a point; my foot doesn't either. (Whose does??!!)
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Not for Supinators!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these but as soon as I put them on, I realized I am not a pronator but a supinator. I could literally feel my feet leaning in. I sent them back immediately. I am sure they are great for pronators.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I have alot of problems with my feet
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I have alot of problems with my feet. Mortons neuroma, plantar facitis, Achilles tendinitis... just to name a few, so I am a big fan of zero drop, but I need a good bit of cushion for my tendon issues. These shoes have good toes room. Could be a little bit more as they are a little snug in the bridge area, but overall a very comfort shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Voice of Contention

customer_reviews.title: Pushes big toe, narrow toe box, and eyelet pressing on bunion
customer_reviews.text: Narrow toe box, different shaped toe box that pushes the big toe and cramps the toes, and an eyelet right over the first met head on the medial side which is right where people develop bunions. These do not fit well, and are unlike my previous pair of altars. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Heckinger

customer_reviews.title: Love altras, but not these
customer_reviews.text: I've had many pairs of altras, but these didn't work for me. These shoes are narrower at the arch than others in this brand. Because the stability was primarily around the arch, the shoes were uncomfortable, cutting into my arches. Everything else was like my others, so I guess I will skip the stability shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The Provision is a wonderful stability shoe but the Impulse is even better: supportive but extremely lightweight and flexible. It fits my odd feet (wide at the front, skinny in the middle through the heel) beautifully. I did find that a half size up in this shoe worked a little better, providing a bit more space upfront. I am a long-distance road runner, petite and light but with pronation and bunions and these are now my favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Pueo

customer_reviews.title: Love love love these shoes and ordered a blue pair ...
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these shoes and ordered a blue pair too. In most shoes I wear 7-7.5 but these are 8.5. I ordered them first in 7.5 and they fit but not comfortable like my other altras. I measured my feet out and ordered per their measurements and the 8.5 is fantastic and awesome out of the box. The return and exchange for a next size up was seemless and painless. Just measure your feet and order the size per measurement and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Side way lacing
customer_reviews.text: Laces up funny, laces up sideways, would not recomend the shoe because of that. I have other altras that I just loved I did not realize the the shoes laced up strangely when I ordered them. If you like sideway lacing you are in luck for a nice quality shoe, that fits well. I personally did not like the looks of the lacing.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Kline

customer_reviews.title: Great for distance running
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe for overpronating runner! Wide toe box, be sure to order a half size over norm. Great for sprinters or long distance runners. I love the colors as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great light stability running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I was running in the Altra provision 2 prior to these. These are lighter and noticed that I am able to turn over my foot stride faster creating a faster run for me. I wear a 7 1/2 to 8 in regular shoes and get an 8 1/2 in running shoes. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Altra Women's Implse Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run a bit small so I order up one size. have ordered Altra's before they're so comfortable. I bought some for my family. I was a hit they loved them too.
customer_reviews.author: S. hata

customer_reviews.title: Found my shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Been waiting a long time for running shoes that fit my weird feet. I have wide feet in front and a thin heel, and also have high arches and I pronate severely. (yes weird) I was told to look at these by my coach. After much consideration and delaying, I ordered them. I'm AMAZED at the effectiveness and comfort of these shoes. I could feel my running stride completely change and no IT band issues. It is very difficult to find the perfect running shoe, I'm grateful I've found these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: But have many friends who love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I always buy a 1/2 size bigger for running shoes but with this style had to go 1 full size bigger. Not enough cushion for me. But have many friends who love this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoes!
customer_reviews.text: The actual shoes are cuter than pictured, and I like the design. The sole is also very soft. Only thing is that it was too small for me. The width and length are probably true to regular US size, and I have a wide feet. Will order larger size and see if it works better for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for wearing all day!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They have a wide toe box which helps with Plantar fasciitis. I have it so I would know! The wider toe box gives your foot room to breathe. And the shoe has a cool look to it so you don't feel like you're wearing a grandma shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Aarinfaye

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like these. I loved the color
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these. I loved the color. They reminded me of a barefoot runner, with the glove like fit and minimal cushion. Not much support. Very minimal arch. There was too much flexibility with this shoe for my taste. These claimed to have a wide toe-box and I didn't find that to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these shoes. She is a total Altra head now and I can't get her to stop talking about them.
customer_reviews.author: Murls

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did--the shoes are snug
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 6, but after reading reviews, I went up a half size. Glad I did--the shoes are snug, but not uncomfortable. By just looking at them, you would think they'd be bulky and heavy, but they're surprisingly lightweight. The support is awesome. It feels like my arches simply CAN'T collapse. I'm really flat-footed and since getting these shoes, I've had little to no pain while running. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Cushioning is nice and width is fantastic for me but I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Cushioning is nice and width is fantastic for me but I can't recommend zero drop shoes to anyone. Ran in Altras for one season and ended up with injuries to my piriformis.
customer_reviews.author: AOM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My wife runs 5 miles a day and she rates these 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Backyard lover

customer_reviews.title: I went up a half size and they are perfect!! Very comfy Light and supportive I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I went up a half size and they are perfect!! Very comfy Light and supportive I am thinking about getting another pair So I will have them when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: TOO NARROW
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a WHOLE size larger than normal. This shoe is so narrow and i dont have wide feet. Maybe I got a defective pair, I dont know, but I was really disappointed and returned them the same day that they arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Cimone

customer_reviews.title: I like them but I have a lot of trouble getting ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them but I have a lot of trouble getting shoes that don't hurt my feet. Just trying them out
customer_reviews.author: Lynell Sickle

customer_reviews.title: but the are so comfortable it doesnt really
customer_reviews.text: At first I felt they looked a little funky cause they are shaped different, but the are so comfortable it doesnt really matter
customer_reviews.author: vicki belcher

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these shoes
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these. And people notice them and comment how THEY love this brand too.
customer_reviews.author: Annekat

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: They are extremely narrow in comparison to the rest of Altra's shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful shoes! I wear them only inside as I have other shoes for outside. The shoes do heat up the foot after wearing them for awhile. Otherwise, the is a GREAT shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: these were comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: w came quickly, wanted a zero drop shoe, these were comfortable out of the box, I have very,very narrow feet, so for an average person they're probably ikon the width
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: To narrow!
customer_reviews.text: I have many pairs of Altras bc I love the wide toe box! These are very narrow in comparison to other shoes by this brand.
customer_reviews.author: NurseLisa

customer_reviews.title: Toe Box narrower than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Altra reportedly has a wider, more "natural" toe box, but that was not my experience.
customer_reviews.author: SUP'n Woman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't feel good on my feet. Did not stabilize well, either.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Shah

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed at how tight they are
customer_reviews.text: Way too tight!! For a stability shoe in the same class as the Provision 2, I am disappointed at how tight they are. They are lightweight, so I give them 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: The Schmitts

customer_reviews.title: They fit.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit well. I like the unique design.I have a mortons neuroma and these shoes are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene R.

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight, true to size and with room to ...
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight, true to size and with room to wiggle my toes! These are great shoes. I'll. Eve buy any of the brand for fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Berry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! They arrived promptly, as promised. I will use this company again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Least comfortable shoes I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: Least comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I've had Altra shoes before and loved them, these I can't say the same about.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these! So light and flexible but provide the stability needed for pronation.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine A.

customer_reviews.title: I liked it but had to return b/c it's one full ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but had to return b/c it's one full size smaller than an 8. Def. runs small... at least one size!
customer_reviews.author: Cool nerd

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love these shoes. I use them only to run. I have bunions and the wider toe area is ideal for me. My toes and bunions are not achy after any distance I run.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M Fessler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gift to my daughter. I asked her how she likes them. Her reply, "Powerful!"
customer_reviews.author: RichCinti

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Zero drop and foot splay are seriously the best. If you've ever had foot/leg pain while running, you really should check out Altra footwear. These are true to size, I always order a half size larger than my day to day shoe. There is plenty of cushion too keep your feet happy for many many miles. It doesn't hurt that the color is fantastic! Try them! You'll never go back to Nikes for running again.
customer_reviews.author: Bailee Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the walking shoes before and love them. I am sure these will prove just as good
customer_reviews.author: Jane T Walton

customer_reviews.title: I took out the inserts and put in my own ...
customer_reviews.text: I took out the inserts and put in my own orthotics and this make the shoe very tight. There is not a lot of extra room in these.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen P.

customer_reviews.title: Caused me a lot of pain!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these! But I believe the toes are too narrow. I thought it wasn't a big deal until after the 2nd week in them, I started getting serious pain in my big toe joint. Since the shoes are the only thing I have changed I decided to go back to my old shoes for awhile and my pain decreased significantly. But by the time I figured it out that it was these shoes, the return window closed (yesterday!) I am so mad. I will not recommend these to anyone and make sure they know my experience.
customer_reviews.author: JKRods

customer_reviews.title: size 8 fit perfect, other brand running shoes I go for 7
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are too small. I had three other pairs, size 8 fit perfect, other brand running shoes I go for 7.5. For Altra, I need half size bigger . But this pair fits small, size 8 is too small. Have to return.
customer_reviews.author: smile user

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe. It does great for standing 8-12hrs a day at work. Will be looking to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya R Payne

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I had to send them back because they were to tight across the top of my foot and to tight on my small toes. Very weird for a "wide toe box" shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These fit as expected because I already have a pair and knew what to expect from Altra. They fit smaller than any other brand I've tried. Usually I take a size 6 but in the Altras, I take a 6.5. I love the wide toe box and even though this particular model felt too narrow when I first tried them, they felt awesome during my run and are one of the most comfortable pairs I own. Sometimes I'll use them for training but these are my go-to shoe for an event.
customer_reviews.author: Shawper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes!!! Fit to size and are very comfortable. I'm on my feet 10+ hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: shawna anderson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Only issue is being small, I had to order a whole size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Curly

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are so amazing that I have ordered several pair for future miles ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so amazing that I have ordered several pair for future miles when my originals wear out. I was already used to "barefoot" type footwear as I love the New Balance Minimus collection. I like to feel the ground beneath my feet. The Altra Impulse doesn't have as wide a toe box as my New Balance, but it's wide enough and also provides some cushion where the New Balance does not. I love them both, and am tickled to have great running choices :)
customer_reviews.author: FUN

customer_reviews.title: Fit is great for my hard to find size and wide toe box.
customer_reviews.text: Totally awesome fit. Wide toe box. Comfortable. Obviously not a well known company among people because it seems like each time I wear a pair of Altra, people ask me what they are and where I got them. I just can't wear Nikes. They catch peoples eye due to vibrant color and somewhat of a bowling shoe type appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these shoes! I have had plantar fasciitis in both feet for a couple weeks and these have helped tremendously! If you have high arches these are wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Mom

customer_reviews.title: Gave 4 stars as it is a good shoe, just too tight across my forefoot which ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave 4 stars as it is a good shoe, just too tight across my forefoot which is the opposite of what the company advertises, but I get that not everyone has a wide forefoot. Would suggest the Torin if you have bunions and or a wide forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: QueenMaeve

customer_reviews.title: This the best brand of shoe
customer_reviews.text: Runs larger than my last pair. This the best brand of shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: Newlife2011

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in this brand
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were not what I expected. I was disappointed in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: K.Macd

product_meta.title: ALTRA Womens Impulse-W Impulse-w
product_meta.description: Altra Impulse – Women With The completely new Impulse TM, walking hand in hand Light and stable. A lighter, more stable on road running shoe, up to date and with the latest tricks. InnerFlex TM and stabili pod TM technology, for flexible stability where you need it. Built-in moisture drainage holes make it possible to achieve a fast ventilation. Thanks to the ergonomic foot shape TM shape makes the feet Space, even after long runs. The fully cushioned Zero Drop TM – Platform ensures a low impact. Running You With The New Impulse sooner and better. Specs: Weight: 202GR; 7.1 ounces loss: Lightweight Cross Training Ideal Uses: Road Running, Walking, triathlon, improves: Keep the correct posture when running, the toes leg excessive pronation platform: Zero Drop Platform, foot shape TM toe box attenuation Height: 13 mm Midsole: EVA Ultralight/A Bound TM blend with InnerFlex TM outsole: sole A Running Sensor TM insole: 5 mm Contour Footbed Upper: Quick Dry Air Mesh Colour: Aqua Fade
feature_bullets: Running shoe with quick-drying air mesh and lightweight synthetic overlays featuring removable 5mm Contour footbed
Dual-layer EVA midsole with A-Bound top layer that absorbs impact
